On Fri, Sep 28, 2012 at 2:22 PM, Ruben Verborgh <ruben.verborgh@...> w=
rote:
>> If every URI in your app was supposed to be bookmarkable
>> then t=
he term 'entry point' would be meaningless.
>
> Not really. I=92d like to b=
ookmark posts or comment from a blog,
> but that doesn=92t invalidate the b=
log=92s index page as an entry point.
>
> By the way=85 why would anybody b=
e against stable URIs?
> Is there a good reason not to do that?

Of course =
it depends on the practical situation, but it may very well
complicate soft=
ware and data maintenance of the server. And how long
time is implied by "s=
table"? A year, 10 years, 100 years, the life
span of the system?

A server=
 should commit itself to some "official URI:s", or entry
points. But forcin=
g a server to commit itself to maintaining all URI:s
that have ever been pu=
blished to any client seems to me like
introducing unneccesary coupling.

/=
Paul
